intro: Schoenoplectus tabernaemontani f. sub-duvalii, commonly known as the narrowleaf bulrush, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and spike-like inflorescences that bear small, three-lobed flowers. This plant typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes, swamps, and the edges of ponds. It has a rhizomatous root system that helps it spread and colonize new areas. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems, providing habitat and stabilizing soil.
